docs.title: Church Governance Documents
docs.text:
Welcome to the official repository for the governance documents of the church.

This site serves as a centralized reference for the church’s constitution, bylaws, policies, and job descriptions. These documents exist to support faithful ministry, ensure good order, and provide clarity for leadership, staff, and members.

docs.title: Purpose of This Site
docs.text:
The documents published here are intended to:

  • Promote transparency and accountability in church governance
  • Provide clear guidance for leadership roles and responsibilities
  • Preserve governing documents in a stable, accessible format
  • Serve as a living reference that can be updated as the church grows

Unless otherwise noted, these documents represent the current, adopted policies and governing standards of the church.

docs.title: Document Sections
docs.text:
Use the navigation menu to access the following sections:

  • Constitution The foundational principles, doctrinal statements, and organizational structure of the church.

  • Bylaws Operating rules and procedures governing church life, leadership, and decision-making.

  • Policies Approved policies addressing ministry operations, safety, finance, facilities, and conduct.

  • Job Descriptions Defined roles, responsibilities, and expectations for staff and key volunteer positions.

docs.title: Versioning and Updates
docs.text:
These documents may be revised from time to time by the appropriate governing body. When revisions occur, updates will be reflected here to ensure this site remains the most current reference.

For questions regarding interpretation or application of these documents, please consult church leadership.

“Let all things be done decently and in order.” — 1 Corinthians 14:40

docs.title: Bylaws
docs.text:
The Bylaws provide the operational rules by which the church functions on a day-to-day basis.

They establish procedures for decision-making, leadership responsibilities, meetings, and administration in accordance with the Constitution.

docs.title: Scope
docs.text:
The Bylaws typically address:

  • Leadership roles and responsibilities
  • Church officers and committees
  • Business meetings and voting procedures
  • Financial oversight and administration
  • Amendment procedures

docs.title: Relationship to the Constitution
docs.text: The Bylaws operate under the authority of the Constitution and may not conflict with it. In the event of a conflict, the Constitution shall prevail.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: This document describes expected procedures for church committees, with emphasis on the role of the committee secretary and how committee records are managed by the Support Office.

docs.title: Committee Secretary — Core Responsibilities
docs.text:
• Take clear minutes at every committee meeting using the committee minute template (store templates in shared drive or ask the Minister of Administration for the current template).
  • Record attendance, motions (including mover and seconder), voting results, and action items with responsible party and target dates.
  • After each meeting, send finalized minutes (PDF preferred) to: the committee chair, the Minister of Administration, and the Church Secretary (email or via shared drive) within 5 business days.
  • Maintain an ongoing archive of committee minutes and documents for the committee chair and submit any records retention requests to the Minister of Administration.

docs.title: Church Secretary — Receiving & Filing
docs.text:
• Scan and file committee minutes (as received) into the central records archive and update the committee index.
  • Notify the committee chair and Minister of Administration when minutes are received and indicate if any follow-up is required (missing signatures, unclear action items).
  • Follow the records retention policy for committee materials (see Records & Retention section below).

docs.title: Meeting & Scheduling Best Practices
docs.text:
• Confirm meeting time and room with the Support Office at least 7 days in advance.
  • Use the standard committee agenda template and circulate it 48 hours before the meeting when possible.
  • Keep meetings focused and close with clear action items and owner assignments.

docs.title: Records Retention & Confidentiality
docs.text:
• Committee minutes and non-confidential documents: retain for a minimum of 3 years. Finance-related committee documents may follow longer retention per Finance policy.
  • Confidential pastoral or personnel matters should be recorded in a separate confidential file and handled according to Personnel/Privacy policy; confidential files are only accessible to authorized personnel.

docs.title: Templates & Tools
docs.text:
• Committee Agenda Template: [link or store location]
  • Committee Minutes Template: [link or store location]
  • Use the Church Secretary as the primary contact for file submission and archiving questions.

docs.title: Escalation
docs.text:
• If there is a policy question, unresolved financial concern, or governance matter, the committee chair should escalate to the Minister of Administration or Personnel Committee depending on issue type.

Document maintained by the Minister of Administration. Update the committee index and templates as needed.

docs.title: Constitution
docs.text:
The Constitution establishes the foundational principles and governing framework of the church.

It defines the church’s purpose, doctrinal commitments, membership, and organizational structure. All other governing documents, including bylaws and policies, are subordinate to and must be consistent with the Constitution.

docs.title: Scope
docs.text:
The Constitution addresses matters such as:

  • The mission and purpose of the church
  • Doctrinal beliefs and theological commitments
  • Church membership
  • Church governance and leadership structure
  • The relationship between the church and its officers

docs.title: Authority
docs.text: The Constitution is the highest governing document of the church. Any amendments must be adopted in accordance with the procedures defined within the document itself.

docs.title: RACI: A Practical Guide to Role Clarity
What is RACI?
docs.text:
RACI is a responsibility assignment matrix that clarifies who does what in processes, projects, or decisions. Each letter represents a distinct role:

  • Responsible: The person who does the work to complete the task
  • Accountable: The person ultimately answerable for the task's completion (only one person)
  • Consulted: People whose input is sought before decisions or actions (two-way communication)
  • Informed: People who are kept updated on progress or decisions (one-way communication)

docs.title: How RACI Works with Job Descriptions
docs.text:
Job descriptions define your role's purpose, responsibilities, and qualifications—they tell you what you're hired to do.

RACI charts show how you interact with others on specific tasks—they tell you how you work with your team.

Think of job descriptions as the "what" and RACI as the "who does what with whom." A marketing manager's job description might say "oversee campaign execution," while a RACI chart specifies that they're Accountable for the campaign, the content writer is Responsible for creating materials, the legal team is Consulted on claims, and executives are Informed of results.

docs.title: What RACI Can Do
docs.text:
• Eliminate confusion about who has final decision-making authority
  • Prevent gaps where everyone assumes someone else is handling a task
  • Reduce overlap where multiple people duplicate effort
  • Clarify communication flows so people know when to give input versus just stay informed
  • Speed up decisions by identifying the single accountable person
  • Improve cross-functional work by mapping how departments interact on specific deliverables

docs.title: What RACI Cannot Do
docs.text:
• Replace job descriptions or define your overall role and career path
  • Resolve deeper organizational issues like unclear strategy or poor leadership
  • Work without buy-in from the team—it's only effective if people actually follow it
  • Capture nuance in highly collaborative work where roles are fluid
  • Stay current automatically—it requires updates when processes or people change

docs.title: How RACI Clarifies Roles
docs.text:
RACI transforms vague statements into actionable clarity. Instead of "marketing and sales work together on proposals," RACI specifies: Sales is Accountable for winning the deal, Marketing is Responsible for creating proposal content, Product is Consulted for technical specs, and Finance is Informed of pricing.

The key insight: you can be involved in many tasks, but your level of involvement varies. RACI makes this explicit, reducing the frustration of unclear boundaries and preventing the common problem where everyone is "responsible" but no one is truly accountable.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: This document centralizes continuity expectations and a short, repeatable drill template to validate backups for critical roles. Use this to schedule, run, record, and improve quarterly handover drills across staff roles.

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: Applies to staff roles that handle time-sensitive or continuity-critical duties (e.g., Church Secretary, Financial Secretary, FLC Receptionists, Media & Communications). The Minister of Administration is the final sign-off authority for these drills.

docs.title: Schedule
docs.text:
• Frequency: Quarterly (every 3 months) per role.
  • Duration: 60–90 minutes recommended.
  • Participants: Primary role holder, backup(s), and Minister of Administration (or designee) for sign-off.

docs.title: Drill Template (60–90 min)
docs.text:
1. Prepare a short runbook (10–15 min): list of core tasks and any required credentials (where security allows).
  2. Execute (40–60 min): backup performs core tasks while primary observes. Tasks vary by role (see Role Examples below).
  3. Validate & sign-off (10–15 min): reviewer checks outputs against acceptance criteria and signs off or schedules remediation.

docs.title: Acceptance criteria
docs.text:
• Backup completes ≥80% of core tasks unaided.
  • No unresolved critical issues for finance, security, or safety.
  • Runbook updated with any corrections or gaps.

docs.title: Role Examples (core tasks)
docs.text:
• Church Secretary: reception/phone coverage, membership DB update, generate a report, add a calendar event.
  • Financial Secretary: prepare a sample reconciliation, demonstrate dual-authorization deposit workflow, generate stewardship report.
  • FLC Receptionist: facility opening/closing checklist, equipment sanitization, visitor check-in, process a reservation.
  • Media & Communications: publish a weekly worship guide draft, prepare bilingual worship slides, demonstrate playback/setup.

docs.title: Recording the Drill
docs.text:
Use the table below to record each drill. Keep completed entries in this file or in a team-maintained log (Git history provides retention).

Date Role Primary Backup Reviewer Result (Pass/Fail) Notes / Action Items 2026-01-29 Church Secretary Jane Doe John Doe Minister of Administration Pass Backup completed 5/6 tasks; runbook updated.

docs.title: Post-Drill Actions
docs.text:
• Update runbook / job file with any clarifications.
  • Schedule remediation training for gaps and re-test within 30 days if critical tasks failed.
  • Record sign-off and move to the next quarter's plan.

docs.title: Ownership & Retention
docs.text:
• Owner: Minister of Administration (or delegated operations lead).
  • Retention: retain drill logs for a minimum of 3 years (or longer if required for governance reasons).

docs.title: Tips & Best Practices 💡
docs.text:
• Keep runbooks concise and focused on the “must do” tasks.
  • Use realistic, repeatable scenarios rather than exhaustive checklists.
  • Treat drills as opportunities to update docs, not pass/fail audits only.

If you'd like, I can: (A) add a stub log entry for the recent drills we performed, or (B) insert a short link/reference to this file in each role's Quarterly Handover Drill paragraph. Which do you prefer?

docs.title: Job Descriptions
docs.text:
This section outlines the roles, responsibilities, and expectations for staff members and key volunteer positions within the church.

Clear job descriptions support effective ministry by defining authority, accountability, and scope of service.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
Job descriptions are provided to:

  • Clarify responsibilities and reporting relationships
  • Establish expectations for service and conduct
  • Support evaluation and accountability
  • Promote unity and effectiveness in ministry

docs.title: Applicability
docs.text:
These descriptions apply to paid staff and designated volunteer roles as approved by church leadership.

Job descriptions may be reviewed and updated as ministry needs change.

docs.text: Responsible for the comprehensive management of church facilities, grounds, and equipment, overseeing maintenance operations and coordinating with custodial staff to ensure optimal facility conditions for all church activities and programs.

docs.title: Primary Responsibilities (60-70% of time)
docs.text:

  • Manage church vehicle maintenance including cleaning, fueling, repairs, and scheduling
  • Coordinate and perform painting and care of interior and exterior surfaces
  • Operate and maintain heating, cooling, and other building systems according to schedule
  • Supervise grounds maintenance including landscaping, mowing, and exterior upkeep

docs.title: Secondary Responsibilities (20-30% of time)
docs.text:
• Coordinate custodial supply inventory and procurement for all facility needs
  • Arrange facility setups for regular and special church activities
  • Manage custodial services coordination for weddings, funerals, and special events
  • Prepare annual budget recommendations for Building, Grounds, & Transportation section
  • Ensure security protocols including building access and locking procedures

docs.text:

  • Coordinate with Minister of Administration and Church Secretary for special assignments
  • Oversee contractor relationships and service agreements
  • Other duties as assigned by Minister of Administration

docs.title: Required
docs.text:
• High school diploma or equivalent; technical training preferred
  • 3-5 years of facilities management or building maintenance experience
  • Knowledge of HVAC, plumbing, electrical, and general building systems
  • Supervisory or leadership experience
  • Valid driver's license and ability to operate church vehicles

docs.title: Preferred
docs.text:
• Associate degree in facilities management, engineering, or related field
  • Experience in church or institutional facility management
  • HVAC certification or related technical certifications
  • Budget development and management experience

docs.title: Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
docs.text:
• Ability to perform manual labor including lifting up to 75 pounds
  • Indoor and outdoor work in various weather conditions
  • Use of power tools, maintenance equipment, and machinery
  • Flexible schedule including evenings and weekends as needed
  • Ability to respond to emergency facility situations

docs.title: Performance Expectations
docs.text:
• Maintain all church facilities in excellent condition and appearance
  • Manage facility budgets effectively and recommend cost-saving measures
  • Operate within approved budget and follow established purchasing procedures
  • Coordinate seamlessly with custodial staff and church leadership
  • Ensure compliance with safety regulations and building codes
  • Respond promptly to maintenance emergencies and special requests

docs.text: Department Support Reports To Pastor and Minister of Administration FLSA Status Non-Exempt Employment Full-time Date December 17, 2025

docs.title: Position Summary
docs.text: Serves as the primary administrative support for pastoral staff and church operations, maintaining membership records, coordinating communications, and providing exceptional customer service to English and Spanish-speaking members and visitors while supporting the mission and vision of First Baptist Church.

docs.title: Membership & Database Management (35% of time)

docs.title: Financial Secretary
docs.text: Department Support Reports To Minister of Administration FLSA Status Non-Exempt Employment Full-time Date December 17, 2025

docs.title: Position Summary
docs.text: Maintains comprehensive church financial records, processes receipts and disbursements, and prepares financial reports while adhering to strict internal controls and accountability measures designed to ensure fiscal integrity and prevent financial irregularities.

docs.title: Weekly Financial Operations (40% of time)
docs.text:
• Participate in multi-person counting and verification of all church offerings and contributions
  • Prepare and process bank deposits with dual authorization protocols
  • Post weekly offerings to individual member stewardship accounts with accuracy verification
  • Reconcile online giving and other donation sources weekly
  • Process gift acknowledgements and maintain donor documentation per policy
  • Record receipts and disbursements to appropriate general ledger accounts
  • Process memorial gifts and special contributions with proper documentation
  • Maintain separation of duties protocols throughout all cash handling procedures

docs.title: Monthly Financial Reporting (25% of time)
docs.text:
• Prepare comprehensive financial reports for Finance Committee, Deacons, and Church Business Conferences
  • Complete monthly bank reconciliation statements with supervisory review
  • Attend monthly church conferences and special business meetings as required
  • Generate monthly stewardship reports and contribution summaries
  • Prepare monthly variance analysis vs. budget and provide commentary for the Finance Committee
  • Prepare and file monthly payroll tax deposits and reports
  • Communicate budget status to ministry leaders and department heads

docs.title: Payroll and Accounts Payable (20% of time)
docs.text:
• Process bi-weekly payroll with proper authorization and documentation
  • Issue checks for approved invoices following established authorization limits
  • Maintain accounts payable system with proper approval workflows
  • Verify invoice accuracy and budget availability before payment processing
  • Coordinate with Minister of Administration on all expenditures exceeding designated limits
  • Ensure compliance with church financial policies and procedures

docs.title: Government Compliance and Annual Duties (15% of time)
docs.text:
• Prepare and file quarterly 941 reports and annual tax documents
  • Generate W-2 and 1099-MISC forms for year-end reporting
  • Mail annual contribution statements to all donors
  • Assist with annual budget preparation and financial analysis
  • Prepare documentation for the annual independent audit and respond to auditor requests; maintain trial balance backups and audit schedules for the Finance Committee
  • Support ministry event financial management (youth events, dinners, special programs)
  • Maintain strict confidentiality of all personal and financial information

docs.title: Required
docs.text:
• Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field
  • Minimum 3 years of accounting/bookkeeping experience, preferably in non-profit sector
  • Demonstrates personal salvation through faith in Jesus Christ with mature Christian testimony
  • Proficiency in accounting software, payroll systems, and Microsoft Office Suite
  • Strong mathematical skills and exceptional attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Understanding of non-profit accounting principles and tax-exempt regulations
  • Familiarity with role-based permissions, secure password practices, access logging, and general system security principles for financial systems

docs.title: Preferred
docs.text:
• Church or non-profit financial management experience
  • QuickBooks or similar accounting software certification
  • Knowledge of IRS regulations for religious organizations
  • Experience with payroll tax preparation and compliance
  • Understanding of internal control systems and fraud prevention
  • Fidelity bonding available through church insurance (not routinely required)

docs.title: Critical Internal Controls and Accountability Measures
docs.text:
• Annual Audit & Documentation: Prepare and maintain complete records to support an independent annual audit; ensure audit readiness and timely responses to auditor inquiries.
  • Dual Authorization: Deposits, transfers, and disbursements require dual authorization per established thresholds; check-signing follows delegated authority limits.
  • Authorized Signers: Maintain an up-to-date list of authorized check signers and document authorization limits; review list annually with the Finance Committee
  • Segregation of Duties: Financial recording, cash handling, reconciliation, and check issuance are segregated among multiple individuals to reduce risk.
  • Timely Reconciliations: Complete monthly bank reconciliations and supporting schedules within 7 business days of month-end with independent supervisory review.
  • Access Controls & Backups: Financial system access must be role-based with periodic access reviews, secure password/2FA practices, and routine secure backups with a 7-year retention policy for financial records.
  • Contacts & Documentation: Maintain up-to-date bank, payroll, and auditor contact lists and retain copies of bank authorizations, bonding certificates, and relevant documentation
  • Documentation & Retention: All financial transactions require proper supporting documentation and retention according to policy to facilitate audits and reviews.
  • Confidentiality Protocols: Strict adherence to confidentiality and privacy controls for donor and financial information.

docs.title: Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
docs.text:
• Primarily sedentary office work with occasional lifting up to 15 pounds
  • Extensive computer work and detailed numerical analysis
  • Schedule: Monday–Wednesday (primary work days) with required Sunday morning presence for offering collection
  • Occasional evening meetings for church conferences and committee meetings
  • High level of accuracy required with financial data and sensitive information

docs.title: Performance Expectations
docs.text:
• Maintain 100% accuracy in all financial postings and reports
  • Complete monthly financial reports and bank reconciliations within 7 business days of month-end
  • Process payroll without errors and within required timeframes
  • Achieve zero discrepancies in bank reconciliation processes
  • Submit all government reports and tax filings on time and without penalties
  • Respond to Finance Committee or auditor requests within 3 business days
  • Maintain complete confidentiality of financial and donor information
  • Ensure at least one trained backup for all critical financial responsibilities and perform quarterly handover drills to verify continuity

docs.title: Schedule Information
docs.text: Monday–Wednesday (primary work days); Sunday morning presence required for offering collection and deposits. Additional days/hours as needed for month-end close and annual reporting.

docs.title: Reporting Relationships
docs.text: Direct Reports: None Key Internal Relationships: Minister of Administration, Pastor, Finance Committee, Church Treasurer, other administrative staff External Relationships: Bank representatives, payroll services, government agencies, vendors

docs.title: RACI Chart
docs.text: Activity Responsible Accountable Consulted Informed Weekly Financial Operations Financial Secretary Minister of Administration Church Treasurer, Finance Committee Staff Bank Deposits & Dual Authorization Financial Secretary / Church Treasurer (joint) Minister of Administration Finance Committee Staff Payroll & Accounts Payable Financial Secretary Minister of Administration Personnel Committee Staff Monthly & Annual Financial Reporting Financial Secretary Minister of Administration Finance Committee, Church Treasurer Deacons, Church Body Compliance & External Reporting Financial Secretary Minister of Administration Auditor, Legal Counsel Finance Committee

docs.title: Compensation and Benefits
docs.text: Annual salary and benefits package as determined by Personnel Committee and approved in annual church budget.

docs.title: Employment Conditions
docs.text:
• Position continues until terminated by mutual agreement or by request of Pastor or Personnel Committee
  • Two weeks' notice required for resignation unless otherwise mutually agreed
  • Subject to successful completion of comprehensive background checks including criminal, financial, and driving records
  • Annual drug screening required due to financial responsibilities
  • Compliance with all established church policies, financial procedures, and governmental regulations required
  • Ensure at least one fully trained backup for all critical financial functions and participate in quarterly handover drills to validate continuity and documentation

Quarterly Handover Drill: The primary and backup will conduct a scheduled 60–90 minute drill each quarter during which the backup performs core financial duties (prepare a sample bank reconciliation, prepare a sample deposit and demonstrate the dual-authorization workflow, generate a stewardship or financial report, and demonstrate access to financial systems) while the primary observes; success criteria include completing ≥80% of tasks unaided, documenting any gaps, updating the runbook or SOPs as needed, and obtaining sign-off from the Minister of Administration.

  • At-will employment relationship

Reasonable Accommodations

First Baptist Church will make reasonable accommodations to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions of this position.

docs.title: Ethical and Legal Requirements
docs.text:
• Absolute Integrity: Highest standards of honesty and ethical behavior required
  • Confidentiality: Strict confidentiality of all financial and personal information
  • Compliance: Full compliance with federal, state, and local financial regulations
  • Transparency: Open to audit and review processes at any time
  • Accountability: Regular reporting to supervisory staff and governing committees

docs.title: Key Success Factors
docs.text:
• Accuracy: Exceptional attention to detail in all financial processes
  • Integrity: Uncompromising commitment to ethical financial practices
  • Reliability: Consistent, dependable performance in all responsibilities
  • Discretion: Appropriate handling of sensitive financial information
  • Collaboration: Effective working relationships with multiple stakeholders
  • Compliance: Thorough understanding of regulations affecting church finances

docs.text: Department Support Reports To Minister of Administration FLSA Status Non-Exempt Employment Part-time Date December 17, 2025

docs.title: Position Summary
docs.text: Oversees daily operations of the Family Life Center, providing excellent customer service to members and guests while maintaining facility cleanliness, equipment functionality, and safety standards to support the church's community outreach ministry.

docs.title: Facility Operations Management (35% of time)
docs.text:
• Open Family Life Center each morning, ensuring lights are activated and facility is ready for use
  • Monitor equipment usage to ensure the safety of members and guests
  • Coordinate with custodial staff to ensure facility cleanliness
  • Perform equipment sanitization 1-2 times daily using approved cleaning protocols
  • Receive, stock, and maintain inventory of paper products, cleaning supplies, and food supplies; coordinate with kitchen staff on food supply needs
  • Ensure proper laundering and rotation of facility towels and linens

docs.title: Customer Service and Reception (35% of time)
docs.text:
• Greet members and guests professionally, creating welcoming atmosphere
  • Maintain visitor log book by ensuring guests sign in with name and time of entry
  • Monitor surveillance cameras throughout the facility
  • Operate access control system to grant building access to authorized members and guests
  • Answer telephone inquiries and provide information about FLC services and programs
  • Assist visitors with facility orientation and equipment usage guidelines
  • Handle member concerns and facility-related questions promptly and courteously

docs.title: Administrative and Coordination Duties (30% of time)
docs.text:
• Receive facility rental and usage requests and forward them to the Church Secretary for processing
  • Communicate with office staff and Minister of Administration regarding scheduling and facility inquiries
  • Assist with facility setup for outside entities renting or scheduling when delegated by Minister of Administration
  • Support ministry teams including the clothes closet, food cupboard, and weekly meal program by assisting with setup, supply coordination, and facility access as needed
  • Receive and maintain the prayer request log for hospital visits, surgeries, births, and deaths; notify pastoral staff as needed
  • Document and maintain records of equipment maintenance needs and repairs
  • Report facility issues and safety concerns to Facility Manager
  • Perform general secretarial duties as assigned

docs.title: Required
docs.text:
• High school diploma or equivalent
  • Demonstrates personal salvation through faith in Jesus Christ with mature Christian testimony
  • Strong customer service skills and professional demeanor
  • Basic computer proficiency including check-in systems and calendar software
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Physical ability to perform cleaning and light maintenance tasks

docs.title: Preferred
docs.text:
• Previous experience in fitness facility or recreation center operations
  • Knowledge of exercise equipment operation and safety protocols
  • Experience with church facility management or community programs
  • Basic understanding of cleaning and sanitization procedures
  • Conflict resolution and problem-solving skills

docs.title: Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
docs.text:
• Ability to stand and walk for extended periods throughout the facility
  • Lifting and moving supplies and equipment up to 25 pounds
  • Bending, reaching, and cleaning activities throughout the shift
  • Work in various facility environments (gym, weight room, office areas)
  • Exposure to cleaning chemicals and sanitizing products
  • Interaction with diverse community members and facility users

docs.title: Performance Expectations
docs.text:
• Maintain facility opening schedule with 100% reliability
  • Complete equipment sanitization protocols consistently throughout shift
  • Achieve positive customer service feedback from facility users
  • Accurately process all member check-ins without errors
  • Maintain supply inventory levels to prevent shortages
  • Report maintenance issues within 24 hours of identification

docs.text: Position A: Monday, Wednesday, Friday – [8:00AM–5:00PM] Position B: Tuesday, Thursday - [8:00AM–5:00PM] Both positions perform identical duties and responsibilities

docs.text: Creates bilingual digital and print graphics to support church communications and ministry activities. • High school diploma or equivalent; willingness and ability to learn on the job
  • Demonstrates personal salvation through faith in Jesus Christ with mature Christian testimony
  • Basic proficiency with graphic design or image-editing tools (training provided as needed)

docs.text:

docs.text: Primary schedule: Tuesday–Thursday. Flexible hours (evenings and weekends) required for event and worship coverage.

docs.title: Substitute Receptionist
docs.text: Department Support Reports To Minister of Administration FLSA Status Non-Exempt Employment Temporary/As-Needed Date December 17, 2025

docs.title: Position Summary
docs.text: Provides temporary reception and administrative support services when regular support staff members are unavailable, ensuring continuity of church office operations and maintaining professional first impressions for visitors and callers.

docs.title: Primary Responsibilities (80-90% of time)
docs.text:
• Answer and direct all telephone calls and take accurate messages as needed
  • Receive and assist all visitors to the church office in a professional and welcoming manner
  • Handle incoming and outgoing mail including sorting, distribution, and mailing preparation
  • Maintain church calendar awareness for directing inquiries and scheduling appointments

docs.title: Secondary Responsibilities (10-20% of time)
docs.text:
• Provide telephone or email notification of meetings and events as directed by supervisor
  • Perform basic clerical duties such as filing, copying, and data entry as assigned
  • Assist with other administrative tasks to support church office operations
  • Other duties as assigned by Minister of Administration or regular office staff

docs.title: Required
docs.text:
• Pleasant, professional demeanor with excellent customer service skills
  • Clear telephone communication abilities and basic computer literacy
  • Reliable and punctual with ability to work independently
  • Professional appearance and conduct representing the church positively
  • Alert judgment to know when to handle situations independently versus when to defer to supervisor

docs.title: Preferred
docs.text:
• Previous receptionist or office experience
  • Familiarity with church operations and terminology
  • Basic knowledge of office equipment (phones, copiers, computers)
  • Flexible availability for varying work schedules

docs.title: Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
docs.text:
• Primarily sedentary work sitting at reception desk and answering phones
  • Occasional walking within church facility to deliver messages or assist visitors
  • Professional office environment with standard office equipment
  • Variable work schedule based on regular staff availability and church needs
  • No regular hours - called in as needed for substitute coverage

docs.title: Performance Expectations
docs.text:
• Maintain professional, welcoming demeanor with all church contacts
  • Handle routine inquiries efficiently and refer complex matters appropriately
  • Demonstrate reliability when called upon for substitute duties
  • Respond to on-call assignments within 2 hours of notification and be onsite within agreed response window
  • Preserve confidentiality of church information and member communications
  • Support smooth church office operations during regular staff absences

docs.title: Schedule Information
docs.text: Temporary / As-needed basis; schedule varies by staffing needs and is assigned on an on-call basis.

docs.text: Direct Reports: None Key Internal Relationships: Minister of Administration, Regular Support Staff, All Church Staff External Relationships: Church Members, Visitors, Vendors, Community Contacts

docs.title: Policies
docs.text:
Church policies provide practical guidance for ministry operations, safety, conduct, and administration.

These policies exist to promote consistency, accountability, and care in the life of the church while supporting its mission and values.

docs.title: Purpose of Policies
docs.text:
Policies are adopted to:

  • Provide clear expectations and procedures
  • Protect individuals and the church body
  • Support safe and effective ministry
  • Ensure responsible stewardship of resources

docs.title: Policy Authority
docs.text:
Policies are approved by the appropriate governing body of the church and are subject to review and revision as needed.

All policies must be consistent with the Constitution and Bylaws.

docs.title: Common Policy Areas
docs.text:
• Child and youth protection
  • Financial practices
  • Facility use
  • Personnel and conduct
  • Ministry operations

docs.text:
